pageContext.claim: “So-called Birthright Citizenship, which costs our Country billions of dollars and is very unfair to our citizens, will be ended one way or the other. It is not covered by the 14th Amendment because of the words “subject to the jurisdiction thereof.” Many legal scholars agree.”
pageContext.analysis: According to a report from the National Academy of Sciences, immigrants, particularly the first generation, incur costs to the government that are later balanced out by their descendants. Second-generation immigrants end up being a net positive to the government compared with the first generation, as they assimilate and obtain higher levels of education and wages.  Plus, the 14th Amendment along with two key Supreme Court decisions indicates that any child born on U.S. soil has a right to U.S. citizenship. The sole exception is “children of foreign sovereigns or their ministers, or born on foreign public ships, or of enemies within and during a hostile occupation of part of our territory."
